Keywords: Exiles , Fantastic Four , Past , S.H.I.E.L.D. , Soldier
Real Name: Rikki Barnes
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Elevated
TARGETING: Characters, Adjacent
GIRL WITHOUT A WORLD: The first time Rikki Barnes would be KO'd, instead turn her to click #6 then heal her a number of clicks equal to the number of different team abilities that all characters on the map can use.
DREAM OF A SOLDIER: POWER: In any order: Move, Make a close attack, Make a range attack. If she attacks, she uses her printed damage value.
RIGHT HAND OF HEROES: Energy Shield/Deflection, Toughness. // Adjacent friendly characters that are not on their starting clicks modify defense +1.

July 11, 2022
BubbleBuster101
Hmmm, if she uses her speed power to move then quake, wouldn’t she be dealing 3 to all hit targets instead of 2 since the power says she uses her printed damage value when she attacks?
March 17, 2022
Bat-Phreak
By limiting Dream of a Soldier to her printed damage value, Rikki does indeed stay out of the so-called borken category, but she can still do a goodly amount with that 3-damage. 9-space Move to base fig(s), doing either 3-damage to 1-fig or Quake to distribute 2-damage to multiples, then using IT: Characters and Adjacency she can reach out to a soft support figure in the back to say Hi, or she can double-tap a fig she just hit with her close attack. Dream of a Soldier also allows Rikki to deal with a fig whose Defense power switches between Energy Shield / Deflection and Combat Reflexes, allowing her to use the attack mode best suited to avoid allowing the fig to use those powers. Girl Without a World allows you to play Rikki pretty aggressively, knowing that it will take minimum of 2 big hits or 4-5 smaller hits to KO her, all the while allowing you to use the rest of your team free reign to retaliate while they are dealing with Rikki.
